SEARCH
Package control

Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
control.GameEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class GameEngine extends Object implements Runnable
The core class of the program. It's responsible for handling the initialization and synchronization of the other threads. It also provides some runtime checks that make up the whole game's brain.
Version:
1.1.0

    • GameEngine

      public GameEngine()

  • Method Details

    • start

      private void start()
      The initializer method of the game engine, which calls the Thread.start() method.

    • run

      public void run()
      The implementation of the Runnable interface.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • calculateEndPoints

      private void calculateEndPoints(Mario mario)
      Calculates the points rewarded for hitting the final flag based on the height. The higher, the better. It also sums the points for the coins and the time.
      Parameters:
      mario - Mario object used to get the height.

    • checkEndContact

      private void checkEndContact()
      Checks if mario has passed the finish flag and plays the winning animation, as well as calculating the total points collected at the end of the run.

    • createMap

      public void createMap(String mapName, boolean isMultiplayer)
      Creates the selected map and sets the GameStatus to running.
      Parameters:
      mapName - The name of the map to be loaded.

    • drawMap

      public void drawMap(Graphics2D g2D)
      Draws the Map calling Map.drawMap(Graphics2D).
      Parameters:
      g2D - The graphics engine drawing the map.

    • gameLoop

      private void gameLoop()
      Runs the game until the game is over or the player dies. Contains all the game logic and movement checks.

    • pauseTheme

      public void pauseTheme()
      Pauses the theme song by calling SoundManager.pauseTheme().

    • playSound

      public static void playSound(String soundName)
      Plays a specific sound by the given name.
      Parameters:
      soundName - The name of the sound to be played.

    • receiveInput

      public void receiveInput(ButtonAction input)
      Handles all the input received by the player. It checks for the game state and currently selected screen to determine which action needs to be executed by the GameEngine.
      Parameters:
      input - The inputted key-press.

    • receiveIpInput

      public void receiveIpInput(String character)
      Handles the input on the multiplayer screen, only relative to setting the server ip. The other inputs are processed by receiveInput(control.ButtonAction).
      Parameters:
      character - The character that has been pressed.

    • render

      private void render()
      Renders the current frame by repainting the JFrame.

    • reset

      public void reset(boolean isMultiplayer)
      Resets the game completely by resetting the camera position, restarting the theme, sending the player back to the starting position and resetting the score.
      Parameters:
      isMultiplayer - Whether the map needs two marios.

    • resetCamera

      private void resetCamera()
      Resets the camera's position.

    • updateCamera

      private void updateCamera()
      Updates the camera position based on the player's movement. It also prevents the player from going back past the camera view.

    • updateCollisions

      private void updateCollisions()
      Check for all entity collisions with other entities or blocks with MapManager.checkCollisions(GameEngine).

    • updateLocations

      private void updateLocations()
      Updates all entity/tiles locations with Map.updateLocations().

    • getCameraPosition

      public Point getCameraPosition()

    • getGameStatus

      public GameStatus getGameStatus()

    • setGameStatus

      public void setGameStatus(GameStatus gameStatus)

    • getMapManager

      public MapManager getMapManager()

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
